fields.description: It would be nice when selecting the Clone action (from the BitBucket website) and choosing Clone in SourceTree, that the Checkout Branch value is defaulted to the branch that you are wanting to clone locally.  This would reduce inadvertent cloning of other branches by mistake.
fields.summary: Default checkout branch when launching SourceTree via BitBucket clone action

fields.description: When adding a submodule, there is no way to only add the submodule on the highest level. It will always invoke *--recursive* during the git *update submodules*. It would be nice to add an option to the 'advanced settings' in this dialog to only checkout the submodule itself and not its children.
fields.summary: Add option for non-recursive check-out of submodules (add submodule)

fields.description: When I start SourceTree, it immediately crashes. It worked earlier this week. The log is very short. The program throws `BadImageFormatException: Bad IL Range`.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes on startup

fields.description: I generated new SSH keys due to issues with Source Tree not connecting to an existing Repository. Once I click on Actions --> Create or Import SSH Keys, Source Tree displays the error message saying the system crashed.
fields.summary: Source Tree Crash while Adding SSH Key

fields.description:
After creating a branch in Bitbucket, you get a button stating 'Checkout in SourceTree', which is awesome. (this one: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/103025378/sourcetree/checkout-in-source-tree.png). 

After clicking the button, you get a popup in SourceTree with the URL actions (this one: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/103025378/sourcetree/checkout-url-actions.png), but this popup is a 'pop under'. SourceTree opens the popup but it is hidden under all the opened applications. Following is a further elaboration with images about 'hidden' and 'pop under'. 

Current situation:
You click the button button and you get this:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/103025378/sourcetree/pop-under.png
You can see the source tree icon in the taskbar. When you click it, you get the URL actions window.

Desired situation:
But when you click the button, you'd like to see this:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/103025378/sourcetree/pop-up.png
fields.summary: Checkout popup is not visible

fields.description:
Sourcetree should be updated to use one command "git checkout -b branchname" when creating a new local branch and the checkout branch option is selected.  

There is nowhere in SourceTree to create the branch based off local.
fields.summary: Update checkout, and/or create branch function to allow branch creation based off local.

fields.description:
Source tree crash after clone a project from git repo.

using corporate wifi to connect my machine. 

given the repo url and perform project clone. 

After completion of the 100%, source tree crashes
fields.summary: Source tree keep on crashing after clone a new project
Crash on pull request

fields.description: When cloning a repo from Bitbucket into sourcetree, the URL Actions window opens, but stays in the background instead of (what I believe) becoming the active window and coming infront of other open windows.
fields.summary: URL Actions window stays in background

fields.description:
If I commit some code, but do not push it to the server, I no longer get an up arrow indicating that there is a commit that has not yet been pushed. As such, I no longer have a way to tell which of my branches have unpushed commits.

Also, I am currently running version 1.7.0.32509, not 1.6.25, but that wasn't an option in the dropdown.
fields.summary: Unpushed, committed changes no longer show the up arrow

fields.description:
When using source tree in Windows 2012 R2 I've noticed, that if there is U1 and U2 logged in at the same time and U2 clicks on link in stash to checkout branch, U1 gets checkout window with U2 credentials in the link.
SourceTree version is 1.7.0.32509 (can't select it in affets version field).
fields.summary: When several users are logged in, wrong user get's checkout window

fields.description:
Hi,
The time part is not on good format, it stays in 12h format, or it must be in 24h format (see the Attachments)
fields.summary: Date Time error

fields.description: I opened SourceTree and tried to create a pull request through the context menu. I right clicked on the master branch by mistake and selected "create pull request". I then got an app crash window and the application closed.
fields.summary: App Crash when trying to create a pull request

fields.description:
As detailed in [1], SourceTree does not properly support files whose name include special characters, like the ones detailed on Atlassian Answers (Catalan's "ç" and Spanish "ñ").

For English users is easy to say it's not recommended to use them, but for most non-English projects this can be a real issue if they include files generated, for example, by end-users.

As it's the case of many non-English projects, I've prioritized it as a "Blocker" issue (in fact, I currently cannot merge form SourceTree a branch which includes many of them.

I've attached some images:
- The "importAssetsAndRelationships_LAE_Logroño.xls" was detected as to be deleted by SourceTree.
- If tried to stage it, the following error message appeared:

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree rm -q -f -- xms/framework/architecture/integtests/src/test/resources/importAssetsAndRelationships_LAE_Logroño.xls 
fatal: pathspec 'xms/framework/architecture/integtests/src/test/resources/importAssetsAndRelationships_LAE_Logroño.xls' did not match any files
Completed with errors, see above

- If I try to re-create it by adding it to the browser, it appears both as new and modified (see the attached "st.png").

- If I go to the command line, I can see the following (please, notice how the special character is represented by git as "\303\"):

[code]
# On branch feature/GC-1895
# Your branch is ahead of 'bitbucket/feature/GC-1895' by 4 commits.
#
# Changes not staged for commit:
#   (use "git add/rm <file>..." to update what will be committed)
#   (use "git checkout -- <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)
#
#	modified:   "importAssetsAndRelationships_LAE_ACoru\303\261a.xls"
#	modified:   "importAssetsAndRelationships_LAE_Logro\303\261o.xls"
#	deleted:    "../../../../../risk/integtests/src/test/resources/importAssetQualitativeValues_LAE_ACoru\303\261a.xls"
#	deleted:    "../../../../../risk/integtests/src/test/resources/importAssetQualitativeValues_LAE_Logro\303\261o.xls"
#	deleted:    "../../../../../risk/integtests/src/test/resources/importAssetRisks_LAE_ACoru\303\261a.xls"
#	deleted:    "../../../../../risk/integtests/src/test/resources/importAssetRisks_LAE_Logro\303\261o.xls"
#
# Untracked files:
#   (use "git add <file>..." to include in what will be committed)
#
#	"importAssetsAndRelationships_LAE_ACorun\314\203a.xls"
no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a")
MacBook-Pro-de-Oscar-Bou-Bou:resources oscarboubou$ 


[code]

Thanks for your comprehension!






[1] https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/321885/git-sourcetree-on-osx-and-?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fanswers.atlassian.com%2Fquestions%2F321885%2Fgit-sourcetree-on-osx-and-&application=acac
fields.summary: Files with special characters not supported with GIT or HG

fields.description:
If you set your password (let's say it's "My Password") in Options | Network | Authenticate, and selected "Add proxy server configuration to Git / Mercurial"
However the proxy server still gives me a 407 error.

When looking in .gitconfig you see
proxy = http://username:My+Password@myserver:port

If you manually change it to url encode the space it works, i.e.
proxy = http://username:My%20Password@myserver:port

If you try doing this directly in the password input then the % gets escaped (i.e. My%2520Password).

Can spaces be converted to %20 rather than + in passwords?
fields.summary: Spaces not handled properly in proxy password line in config.
SourceTree for Windows

fields.description: In general: cloning is not working, because SourceTree treats valid URLs as not valid. I believe it might be because SourceTree was just installed. The same URLs works fine in a SourceTree instance, that was already installed on a different PC. Many ways to reproduce.
fields.summary: cannot clone bitbucket repository into SourceTree

fields.description:
Whilst viewing a branch with staged/unstaged files, right click a file in the unstated area and choose Discard to throw away the changes.

The initial dialogue (Confirm Discard?) has OK/Cancel. Press [ENTER] as that is the default option.

New dialogue shown (Add/remove files). Has a Close option.

At this point you will notice that the Close and the Commit buttons (the commit button is behind the dialogue) are both "active".

Pressing [ENTER] and expecting Close to be acted (as the dialogue is in front), fails.

Pressing [ESCAPE] does nothing (very annoying - escape to dismiss dialogs with only 1 option is a perfectly reasonable approach).
fields.summary: Pressing [ENTER] no longer closes dialogue.

fields.description:
When a user clicks "Check out/Clone in SourceTree" button, the URL Action menu is not brought to the user's attention. Instead it is hidden behind SourceTree's main app menu and not even highlighted at the necessary menu:

!urlactionhidden.png|thumbnail!

It'll be great if we can bring SourceTree to the foreground when opening this dialog, if Windows will allow.
fields.summary: When a user clicks "Check out/Clone in SourceTree" button, the URL Action menu is not brought to the user's attention.

fields.description:
Windows is confused by files which are identically named except for case, and in fact won't allow two files like this to exist on the same system. This confuses any application expecting the different files to actually be present. 

In this example, I am viewing a git repo of the Linux Kernel on a local Windows file system with SourceTree. This local repo is mostly complete, with the exception of certain files that conflict with the aforementioned Windows limitation. 

SourceTree erroneously indicates that these certain (netfilter-related) files have been changed and are currently Uncommitted Changes, when in fact what it actually sees is, for example, an uppercase-named file in the remote repo and a lowercase-named (but different) file on the local file system.

It would be nice if SourceTree could discern that it's on a non-case-sensitive OS when in Windows, and determine certain files are not actually uncommitted changes. Perhaps allow the Ignore option to be enabled for these files. An indication of a remote file that *would* be on the local file system if not for the case issue could be displayed in a different color with some kind of indication of the issue. 

As an example of the problem, see the following files as a git repo viewed under Windows via SourceTree for an example:

Linux Kernel 3.2.0
/include/linux/netfilter/xt_mark.h
/include/linux/netfilter/xt_MARK.h
fields.summary: SourceTree is confused when viewing a Linux Kernel git repo under Windows

fields.description: Background refresh of remotes is not working anymore for me, might have something to do with the fact that I put my PC to standby a lot.
fields.summary: Background refresh not working

fields.description: I have multiple repositories that are closely linked to a certain product (not using submodules or subtrees). When I gitflow a release candidate I need to gitflow each one separately, and then checkout each one separately. If I need to switch back-and-forth between rc and develop I need to do each repository one-by-one. It would be really useful to be able to define a grouping of branches from the different registered repositories so they can be changed in batch.
fields.summary: Grouping of branches from multiple repositories to batch checkout

fields.description:
If I right click on a modified item and select commit focus does not move to the commit panel nor does the commit button get activated.  The Item does get checked.

If I switch views, e.g. click a branch, then click back to working copy the button is now active and I can commit as usual.

also happens if multiple items are selected.
fields.summary: Commit Button not activated when using right-click->commit menu

fields.description:
The clickable checkbox area for the "Push changes immediately to remote" checkbox is way to large. When I try to click "Commit" I sometimes miss and accidentally check the box - which I *do not* actually want to do.

Image:
 !image-2016-01-05-12-53-34-131.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Checkbox area too large for Push Changes immediately to remote checkbox

fields.description:
When attempting to use the 'GitFlow' button in sourcetree, if gitflow is configured in the git global config, sourcetree does not detect the configuration.  It instead prompts the user to perform a git flow init process per usual, and then you get the following dialog:


{code:java}
sh.exe C:\Users\chet_husk\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\gitflow_local\gitflow\git-flow init -d
Already initialized for gitflow.
To force reinitialization, use: git flow init -f


Completed successfully.
{code}

Subsequent uses of the 'gitflow' button run through the same setup process above.

Once I copy the changes from my global gitconfig to the repo-local config then the 'gitflow' button behaves as expected and I see the 'work on features/hotfixes/releases' options.
fields.summary: Git Flow dialog does not respect git global config

fields.description:
I've got a couple repositories hosted over ssh. The password and username are saved. When I change something in a submodule, this does +show+ in the parent repository, but I can +not commit+ the changes from the parent repository. This is possible when the repository is a local repository.

Also, if I have a project with multiple layers of submodules, SourceTree only checks one layer for changes. The top-most does not have any indication for changes in any sub- of submodule, or deeper.
fields.summary: No recursive submit when submodule remote is over ssh

fields.description:
One of our repositories in Github does not clone when using Sourcetree. We do not receive any meaningful error in Sourcetree. Other repos in the same organisation are fine, permissions seem fine on github. This is happening on multiple systems in our organisation. We also get an error for "templates not found" but this does not seem to affect other repos. Using SourceTree 1.7.0.32509 and some earlier versions from December. Cannot find this version ID in 'Affects Version'. Also occurring in 1.6.25.

Using the same command in the git embedded commandline from Appdata\local\atlassian\sourcetree\git_local\cmd\ the repo pulls down correctly with no errors.

Any help would be greatly appreciated.
fields.summary: Cannot clone a repository from Github using Sourcetree, embedded git command line works perfectly.

fields.description:
When using GitFlow to finish an action you should be able to alter the generated tag message.
There is a checkbox and a text box.
When disabling the checkbox the resulting commit in master branch is not tagged, when activated it is tagged with the name of the branch.
This is fine, when the text box is empty then the branch name should be taken.
If not then the text in the text field sould be taken but this is not the case.
fields.summary: GitFlow "Tag with this message" does not work

fields.description: I tried repairing and reinstalling and It didn't help.

fields.description:
I'm installing on a brand new laptop. Version 1.7.0.32509 fails at startup complaining about not being able to load dynamic DLL entry points.

I downgraded to 1.6.25 and although it starts up, trying to clone my GIT repo reported errors about templates not being present.

I downgraded to 1.6.23 and although is starts attempting to clone my repo reports the repository type is invalid (even when using the dialog to list hosted repos).

I ended up restoring my local version from a backup and configuring this in SourceTree. This worked. I then upgraded to version 1.7 and it still seems to work (although I haven't yet made any code changes to test if the pushes work).
fields.summary: Version 1.7 crashes on startup

fields.description:
I would like to be able to right click on a branch and run a custom action like "git merge --squash $BRANCH"

Could you make the selected branch a custom variable that we could use in the custom action?  Note that you would most likely be on a  branch like "master" and wanting to right click on another branch to merge (squash) into master.  

Thanks!
fields.summary: Custom actions to support branch variable

fields.description:
When resolving conflicts on a merge in sourcetree I think there is an opportunity for improvement to the UI. If the resolution of the conflict was to resolve using 'Mine' and there are no other file changes pending it isn't clear that a commit is required to finish the merge.

The only indication is in the bottom right hand corner where the status has been changed from !image-2015-12-31-14-15-58-640.png|thumbnail! to !image-2015-12-31-14-14-52-828.png|thumbnail! 

Can it me more obvious that a merge is pending?  Can sourcetree generate a special uncommitted change? So the user knows action is required to finish the merge?
fields.summary: Better Communication to User of Pending Merge Conflict to be Resolved
Repository Tabs should have commands - close all, close all but the current

fields.description:
I am attempting to use pull to bring in changes from my master branch into my feature branch.  Both branchs have the same submodule.  The submodule pointer has been updated in my master branch only.  No additional submodules have been added.  

If there are no conflicts in the files being pulled into my feature branch when I perform the pull from master onto my feature branch the submodule pointer change is staged and the pull process is working as expected.  

See Image:

"Submodule Only Change"

If there *are* conflicts in any of the files when I perform the pull from master onto my feature branch the submodule pointer change appears in both the staged and unstaged boxes.  The submodule pointer reference is not in conflict here it should appear as a staged change only.  If I highlight the change to see the differences no information is displayed so I am not sure which submodule pointer is staged to be committed.    In addition if I commit the submodule the unstaged one stays and I have to discard it.  

See Images:

"Files After Pull with conflicts"
"After Commiting Merged Conflicted Files"
"After Commiting Merged Conflicted Files"

Additionally if a merge issue does arise with a submodule pointer then it automatically stages the pulled in change and does not inform the user that the file was in conflict.
fields.summary: Pulling in Updated Submodule with Conflicts in other files

fields.description:
My repos have a large number of Tags and I spend a lot of time looking for specific commits using these Tags. It would be very useful to be able to search for a commit using a Tag.
Sid.
fields.summary: Search for Tag

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a repo in SourceTree has multiple submodules, deleting one of them will result in the deletion of all submodules.

h3. Environment
SourceTree for Windows, version 1.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the tab of a git repo in SourceTree
# Add two submodules
# Right click on one of the submodules, named e.g. X, and select {{Delete X}}

h3. Expected Results
Submodule X is deleted from the repo.

h3. Actual Results
Both submodules in this repository are removed.

h3.Workaround
No workaround available.
fields.summary: Deleting a single Submodule in SourceTree results in the deletion of all submodules in this repo

fields.description:
Normally, with OpenSSH as SSH client and 1 SSH Key set under _Options>General>SSH Client Configation_, when SourceTree starts a terminal shell pops up asking the user to authenticate the key. Which is great.

If another key is added via _Tools>Add SSH Key_, this is appended in the SSH Key input. Each key is separated by ";"

What I would expect is that from shell I should be prompted in turn for each one of the keys.
What actually happens is that the shell opens and closes immediately, without prompting.
The same happens with 1 key and a trailing ";", or with a non-existent key path.

It would seem that ";" breaks the parsing.

Happy to provide more information if needed to investigate this.

Thank you,
vinz

 

 
h2. Workaround

 Replace Semi-Colon - ( ; ) with two double quotation ( " " )

Example
{code:java}C:\Users\<User>\.ssh\id_rsa1" "C:\Users\<User>\.ssh\id_rsa2

{code}
fields.summary: multiple ssh keys are not parsed correctly on ssh-agent start
Still update and init submodule after disable submodule in option -> git

fields.description:
I was trying to reset hard one of my three repositories but Git give me a error and Source Tree crashed

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false reset -q --hard HEAD --
error: unable to unlink old 'System/web/wwwroot/workflow/wf_form/form_upload.php' (Invalid argument)
fatal: Could not reset index file to revision 'HEAD'.


Completed with errors, see above.
fields.summary: Crashed on reset

fields.description:
I've got a git repo bookmarked, which at latest count has over 4337 untracked files.  Most of these are binary files of <1MB each, and some of them are large JSON files.  They live in a large directory structure, about 200 folders wide and about 4 deep.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Opened the above repo (SourceTree hangs for a little bit, but not too badly)
2) Close SourceTree, go away for Christmas
3) Come back, open SourceTree to work on another project
4) SourceTree goes to open the last opened project, and occupies a full core of the CPU for several minutes.  
5) It eventually opens - the tab it shows (presumably the last one I had open) is the "file status" tab
6) I close the bloated project.

I totally get that this project is one of the "hard cases" - lots of fairly large files, in a huge tree of folders.  And the consequences are fairly small - I had to wait a few minutes.  But I figured you guys might want to know about it.

Other possible contributing factor: at the time, I have 15 repos bookmarked.  Most of them use public-key authentication via Pageant.  At the time of this issue, pageant didn't have the required keys.  So it's also possible that attempting to fetch for 15 different repos may have contributed.

If you want to use this repo to reproduce the issue, it's here: https://github.com/jwalthour/msl_3d_viewer . The readme and commandline help explain how to download the untracked files - the source itself is fairly small.
fields.summary: Sourcetree hangs and pegs CPU when opening a git repo with many untracked files

fields.description: After update to SourceTree to version 1.7.0.32509 all my repositories were removed from it.
fields.summary: SourceTree update remove previous existent repositories

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Checking 'Add proxy configuration to Git/Mercurial' when default operating system settings for proxy are used, but no proxy is set for the system, results in an entry proxy = http://www.google.com:80 being added in ~/.gitconfig file.

h3. Environment
Windows -- reproduced with Windows 7 and SourceTree version 1.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to {{Control Panel}} in Windows.
# Select {{Internet Options}}, then tab {{Connections}}.
# Select {{LAN Settings}}.
# Uncheck {{Use a proxy server for your LAN}} (in case it is checked).
# Go to SourceTree, menu {{Tools >> Options}}.
# Select tab {{Network}}.
# Select {{Use default operating system settings}}.
# Check {{Add proxy configuration to Git/Mercurial}}.

h3. Expected Results
No proxy should be added in the ~/.gitconfig file.

h3. Actual Results
The line {{proxy = http://www.google.com:80}} is added in the ~/.gitconfig file.
fields.summary: Checking 'Add proxy configuration to Git/Mercurial' when default operating system settings for proxy are used, but no proxy is set for the system, results in an entry proxy = http://www.google.com:80 being added in ~/.gitconfig file

fields.description:
I often do extra compression for existing images.  It would be nice to to see touched file times & file size when staging changes.  Can help prevent committing the wrong version of binaries.
eg:
Before:
{color:#d04437}2015-12-12 05:00am
240.02k{color}
After:
{color:#14892c}2015-12-23 11:02am
219.44k{color}
fields.summary: durring Staging, compare file details for binary files

fields.description:
I wrote the right password for my Bitbucket account and that window still appears few moments later. Very annoying.

This is happens after the last two SourceTree updates.

Steps to reproduce it:

# Add your Bitbucket account.
# Do something (pull, fetch, push, commit, so forth).
# Change the password of your Bitbucket account.

SourceTree fails to update the account with the new password. The workaround is delete and add again the same account.
fields.summary: The "Authenticate" window appears constantly

   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)
fields.summary: ST shows "uncommitted changes" but when I try to do a commit, it errors out.  When I come back in, if I press the "Pending files, sorted by" button, I get this error

fields.description:
While I was trying to update Sourcetree to version 1.7.0, the attached error occurred. The installer became unresponsive and I had to terminate the process.

When I ran the installer another time, everything went fine.
fields.summary: Error while installing version 1.7.0.32509

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A user checks out a remote branch with ST, under a folder, e.g. checks out branch staging as folder1/staging. If he then tries to push the branch, in the Push dialog, the suggested Remote branch is folder1/staging instead of the tracked branch.

h3. Environment
This has been reproduced with version 1.7 of SourceTree for Windows.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Clone a repo with more than one branches, e.g. branches master and staging.
# Checkout the staging branch under a subfolder, like below: 
!Screen Shot 2015-12-22 at 12.18.50.png|thumbnail! 
# Try to push staging by either clicking the Push button on the top, or by right-clicking the branch in SourceTree >> Push to origin/staging (tracked).

h3. Expected Results
The push dialog should try to push branch in the remotely tracked branch staging.

h3. Actual Results
The push dialog attempts to push the branch to (non-existent) remote branch folder1/branch:
 !Screen Shot 2015-12-22 at 12.10.15.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The Push dialog does not suggest the correct Remote branch, for local branches that have been checked out in a folder

fields.description: The crash occurs usually after typing a word in the commit log texbox and then pressing space, though it seem to occur quite randomly. This only happens on my workstation several times a day. This does not manifest on my home PC which has the same OS(except Pro edition).
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when typing commit message

fields.description:
I have version 1.7.032509
Which is not available in the drop-down list above

When I try to create a pull request, sourcetree crashes.
In the log it says
ERROR [2015-12-22 10:23:22,469] [1] [SourceTree.AppRoot] [HandleCrash] - Fatal error
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.

I've attached the log file

Steps to reproduce
1. I select a local branch,
2. right click with the mouse
3. select create pull-request
fields.summary: trying to create pull-request crashes source tree

fields.description: On the Log/History pane, when right clicking a Submodule and clicking 'Open', the Open menu doesn't do anything.
fields.summary: Log/History panel -> Submodule -> Right Click -> Open doesn't do anything

fields.description: After the update, pressing Discard hunk or Discard lines buttons shows spinner, but discard does not happen.
fields.summary: Discard hunks/lines not working after update

fields.description: The screen error message and log are attached.  Sourcetree will not open.  I downloaded the most recent versions and reinstalled it, but the error is the same. Windows control panel indicates the version number is 1.7.0.32509 but this version is not listed in the drop down menu on the "create issue" window.
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes when opening

fields.description:
On the "Edit hosting account" screen, coming from the Clone/New repository screeen: when trying to connect to a bitbucket server instance using ssh keys, the error message "URI prefix not recognized" pops up, and it's impossible to add the account.

The error doesn't occur when the ssh:// prefix is used in the new/clone screen Url input.
fields.summary: URI Prefix not recognized on Edit Hosting Account screen
Provide the ability to apply a specific file in a given stash

fields.description:
When I tried to clone a gitolite repository which needs ssh key, SourceTree gets stuck with showing "Checking Source..." and does not provide any further information.
After I checked out that repository with git command and import it to SourceTree and tried to pull it, there was a "Full Output" checkbox and this time I finally could see what has happened: putty stucked at "The host is not trusted. If you trust this host, enter "y" to add the key to PuTTY's cache and carry on connecting." thing.

I think SourceTree should have "Full Output" checkbox at clone dialog or at least provide information about what's going on during cloning repository to let users take appropriate action to solve the ongoing problem.
fields.summary: Clone failed siliently when the host is not trusted

fields.description:
When cloning an existing repo from Bitbucket in SourceTree by clicking the Clone/New button, then browsing for hosted projects (by pressing the button with a globe on it), all of my repos in BB are listed three times each. This occurs 100% of the time when cloning via this method.

I will attach screenshots if requested, but all my projects are private,and don't want the images publicly available.
fields.summary: Cloning bitbucket repos from ST shows 3 of everything

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you switch branches in SourceTree and then try to Pull, the Pull dialog sometimes tries to pull changes in the wrong branch (not the current one).

This seems to happen intermittently (e.g. 1 time out of 10 attempted).
It seems to occur if you press the Pull button right away (very fast) after you switch branches.

h3. Environment
This has been reproduced in versions 1.6.25 and 1.7 of SourceTree for Windows.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a git repository with 2 branches (let's say master and staging) in SourceTree Windows.
# Switch to master branch (if not there already).
# Double-click on staging branch from the list 'Branches' on the left.
# Right after the dialog for switching branches closes, press the 'Pull' button from the menu on the top.

h3. Expected Results
The Pull dialog should ask to pull changes in current branch, staging in that case:

 !Screen Shot 2015-12-18 at 13.29.36.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Sometimes, the result is as expected.

Other times, the Pull dialog attempts to pull changes into master branch (which is not the current branch):

 !Screen Shot 2015-12-18 at 13.22.43.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Attempt to Pull another time
fields.summary: Pressing the 'Pull' button on a repo after switching branches, sometimes results in ST attempting to pull in the wrong branch

fields.description: Filter the name of branches in his pane, to make the searches more easy
fields.summary: Add a filter to the list of local and remote branches

fields.description:
After adding a lot of files to tracker, ST asks for confirm, but I cant see the button to approve

 !image-2015-12-17-17-41-47-738.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Can't see Ok button when big list of files being added

fields.description:
Tab "Log history" is active, and it happens for most (but not all) of my repositories. 
Source tree app restart helps for some time, but it happens again more or less soon
fields.summary: Source tree shows "Loading..." instead of repository files

fields.description: When looking at "Log / History" for a repo, "branch" should be a column (along with Graph, Description, Date, Author...) so that one can see what branch each commit is on.
fields.summary: Have a column for "branch"

fields.description: The username for a given repo is saved in sourcetree (awesome), but when I log in as another user it is still saved, and the only way of clearing it is by going through the options and deleting the entry that's conflicting (not awesome). This causes issues on machines which are used by multiple people.
fields.summary: Cannot opt out of saving username

fields.description:
I would like to see those tags that are not yet pushed to the remote.

Use case: These tags are used in an automatic build system. And when someone forget to push them to the remote, the build breaks... If everyone had a visual clue for missing tags on the remote, this would save some time for resolving those kind of errors.
fields.summary: Display the tags that are not pushed to remote

fields.description:
When I try to apply patch source TreeCrashes. I have attached error and log file.
Btw error window does not allow to copy text with Ctrl+C.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when trying to apply patch

fields.description:
I want to identify all changes in a file made within a range of selected commits.
If I select two or more commits in the log file window not all changes are displayed in the div view on the right side. The list of displayed changes varies if I select another range of commits, but it is usually not complete.

Example:
one commit
 !A1.PNG|thumbnail! 

a second commit
 !A2.PNG|thumbnail! 

now booth commits are selected but not booth changes are displayed in the div view.
 !A1+A2.PNG|thumbnail! 

The incomplete change list will also be passed to the external div tool.
fields.summary: Select multible commits in file log window does not show all changes

fields.description: If I try to do a git fetch or git push I be ask to enter a password for accessing the remote. I'm using Putty Agent and the private key is loaded there. It seems that the console can't access that key. Everything works fine within source tree (no prompting for passwords). But from time to time I need to force push which isn't possible without git console.
fields.summary: Embeded console can't access remote repository

fields.description:
Once and then a push will never complete. "Full Output" will show this state for ever:

{code}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false push -v origin mybranch:mybranch
Pushing to ssh://git@git.ourrepo.net:7999/jj/our-project.git
{code}

If I restart Source Tree, the push will complete fine. But the situation will reappear randomly.

How do I collect more information to help you diagnose the problem?
fields.summary: Push hangs sometimes

fields.description:
Initial description from customer:

{quote}
SourceTree does open the Araxis Merge but Araxis merge complains that the temp file of the previous version does not exist
{quote}

Further troubleshooting notes:
#1 SourceTree can't display diffs for binary files
#2 Araxis Merge file is not working when the start/compare button is clicked.
fields.summary: External Diff with Araxis Merge fails

fields.description:
Customer's description:

{quote}
When I select any file, the preview tab refreshes all the time, so the code is shown for a second and then it's gone. It refreshes the tree file structure so all the folders that were open reset to closed, and I lose all the scrolls that I made to see the code.

This is an intermittent error, sometimes the code is gone, sometimes it just refreshes, some folders remain open, other close all the time, specially if they are located farther in the tree structure (like sub-sub-folders).

This is VERY annoying and I need to use external tools to see the diffs in my code.
This wasn't happening in older versions.
{quote}

Also, the files, though refreshes all the time, the date modified remains the same.
fields.summary: My SourceTree keeps refreshing the code.

fields.description: When using the Add/Remove button for files that have been moved, after check-in the old files show as needing to be deleted, so the operation doesn't really work correctly. This is with Mercurial (hg).
fields.summary: Add/remove misses file

fields.description:
I have 2 git repositories on same gitlab server, say "ssh://git@repo.myserver:7999/app1.git" and "ssh://git@repo.myserver:7999/app2.git". I want to change repo path of app1, from menu Repository -> Repository Settings..., select origin then click Edit, I change the URL/path to "ssh://git@repo.myserver:7999/app1a.git" and click "OK" button to save it. After that I do the same to app2. I found that on Repository Settings page of app2, the path is already changed to the same URL of app1. I change URL again for app2 and go back to app1, app1's URL is changed as well.
I have 5 apps on same server, every time I change URL/path of one app, all other apps would be changed. 
I found this after I upgraded to 1.7.0 today. I did not see this happening on previous versions.
fields.summary: Git repository path is overwritten by changes to another repository path
Git Flow not working

fields.description: go to repo, actions, apply patch, select file, click "apply patch" => application crashes
fields.summary: Application crashes when applying patch file

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When a change is made in a Submodule, an indication is shown at the moment only in the parent repository tab, like below:

 !Screen Shot 2015-12-14 at 12.43.04.png|thumbnail! 

No indication is shown in the parent repository in the repository list on the left:

 !Screen Shot 2015-12-14 at 12.11.15.png|thumbnail!

The user cannot see that changes have been made in the submodule, unless he opens the parent repository tab.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
When changes are made in a Submodule, show an indication in the parent repository in the repository list on the left.

This way the user will get a quick grasp on the state of the repository without having to open each one of them individually to check for changes in the Submodules.
fields.summary: As a user I want to see an indication that a Submodule has been modified, in the parent repository in the repository list

In our project we have big set of branches and using cherry pick operation a lot. Sometimes you may spend a lot of time finding your commits that you would like to merge/cherry pick.
It would be nice to have possibility to highlight your commits in a list.
fields.summary: Highlight my commits in a list (or somebody's else)

fields.description: Tree view would work best for me if there was an option to have the working copy view automatically expand all nodes in the tree. Please make this an option.
fields.summary: Tree View Start Expanded Option

fields.description: right click on a branch -> create pull request -> crash
fields.summary: crash when trying to create pull request
ProgAppsFinals

fields.description: Could SourceTree implement something like Git Tower drag and drop. It makes for a very intentional way to indicate action between two branches.
fields.summary: Drag N Drop Merge/Rebase

fields.description: When SourceTree is open, disk is constantly being accessed by "Git for Windows" at 100% of its read capacity, slowing down everything else on the machine considerably. Git on command line doesn't seem to do this. Last night, it was left open overnight and after 16 hours or so it was still at 100%.
fields.summary: Source tree is running very slow and keeping disk access at 100% indefinitely.

fields.description:
_{color:red}(I accidentally mixed up which Atlassian product's updater was having issues. If possible, please move this to the HipChat project in your JIRA. I would delete this issue, but I don't see a way for me to do so. Sorry for any inconvenience.){color}_

The window that opens telling users about the HipChat 4 update (at least on my Windows 7 computer) does not let the user do anything other than install the update.  The "Skip this version", "Remind me later", and window-close buttons all have no effect.  I had to close HipChat itself to get that update window to go away.
fields.summary: [Sorry, wrong project:] Buttons for declining/delaying HipChat 4 update don't work

fields.description:
Windows 8.1
SourceTree 1.6.4.0
Git
fields.summary: Git log failed with code 128 could not read

fields.description:
This seems to be CONF-31953 appearing again:
The sourcetree window stays in front covering other windows, even when not in focus. This makes e.g. resolving conflicts particulary difficult, as the mergetool isn't reachable when Sourcetree was fullscreen.
fields.summary: SourceTree window is always on top when not in focus, covering other windows.

fields.description:
It would be quite useful to be able to get contents of a hunk on to the clipboard. One way to do this would be to allow the user to select and copy any text from the hunk viewer pane.

Alternatively, there could be a context menu action available for each hunk.
fields.summary: Allow user to highlight and copy text in Log/History hunk viewer

fields.description: Removed file list is TOO long
fields.summary: Removed file list is TOO long

fields.description:
Sourcetree says {{fatal: Authentication failed for [url]}} when trying to do anything against the remote. The remote is Stash, and the client is Sourcetree 1.6.24. It is a FRESH install. I'm using embedded Git 2.6.1.

Every time this happens, an authentication dialogue pops up asking me to enter a password. I do that, and then the same message reappears in "full output". The password I'm entering is absolutely CORRECT. The username is, too.

A fetch or pull (or anything against the remote) works fine on the command prompt (just a normal one, no fancy cygwin or cmder!) when it asks for my username and password.

If I switch to system Git 2.6.1 any action against the remote keeps loading forever. No messages appear in full ouput. Might be related, might be a separate bug.

So, basically I can't do my work.
fields.summary: Authentication failed

fields.description:
On Push button press, auto select only the currently checked-out branch.

Scenario:
Lets say I have on my repository two branches.
1. Master
2. Develop

I have checked-out Develop branch, i have changes; i commit them; i select the push button, and by default it selects all of the branches i have checked out locally.

I need it only to select the current branch.

Reasons: there are hardly any scenarios when i need to push to two branches at the same time.
fields.summary: On Push button press, auto select only the currently checked-out branch

fields.description:
When I try to pull, push, or fetch an existing repo from the remote bitbucket repository it loops forever. If I show the full output, I get this:

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false fetch origin
The server's host key is not cached in the registry. You
have no guarantee that the server is the computer you
think it is.
The server's rsa2 key fingerprint is:
ssh-rsa 2048 97:8c:1b:f2:6f:14:6b:5c:3b:ec:aa:46:46:74:7c:40
If you trust this host, enter "y" to add the key to
PuTTY's cache and carry on connecting.
If you want to carry on connecting just once, without

adding the key to the cache, enter "n".
If you do not trust this host, press Return to abandon the
connection.

But, if I go to the Terminal I can push, pull, and fetch without error.
fields.summary: Unable to push, pull, or fetch on Windows 10.

fields.description: Constant asks for authentication
fields.summary: View > Show Hosted Repositories

fields.description: After SourceTree is installed, I accidentally set the *System Git* to a wrong version of Git on my system. I was unable to change this setting from the GUI. Instead, I have to go to {{C:\Users\ME\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\userpickedapps.xml}} and remove/update the settings by manual.
fields.summary: User should be able to change System Git from the GUI

fields.description:
If the File Status list doesn't currently have focus, although a file is selected, if you shift-click to extend that selection range SourceTree crashes.   

A workaround is to always click on an item in the list before doing a shift-click so that the shift click will extend the range.

It seems more intuitive that you can shift click to extend the range based on the currently selected item, even if the file list doesn't have focus.     This works with other actions such as right clicking in that window to bring up a context menu for the currently selected file(s).

The following exception is in the sourcetree.log (I would have attached but I get an error when trying to attach a file)

2015-12-05T18:25:50: Fatal error: 
System.InvalidOperationException: Sequence contains no elements

2015-12-05T18:25:50: Stack trace: 
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.First[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source)
   at System.Windows.Controls.SelectionMultiple.SelectCore(MultiSelectTreeViewItem item) in C:\projects\bitbucket.org\atlassian\sourcetreewin-prod\Dependencies\MultiSelectTreeView\Controls\SelectionMultiple.cs:line 146
   at System.Windows.Controls.MultiSelectTreeViewItem.OnMouseDown(MouseButtonEventArgs e) in C:\projects\bitbucket.org\atlassian\sourcetreewin-prod\Dependencies\MultiSelectTreeView\Controls\MultiSelectTreeViewItem.cs:line 735
   at System.Windows.UIElement.OnMouseDownThunk(Object sender, MouseButtonEventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.InvokeHandler(Delegate handler, Object target)
   at System.Windows.EventRoute.InvokeHandlersImpl(Object source, RoutedEventArgs args, Boolean reRaised)
   at System.Windows.UIElement.RaiseEventImpl(DependencyObject sender, RoutedEventArgs args)
   at System.Windows.ContentElement.RaiseTrustedEvent(RoutedEventArgs args)
   at System.Windows.Input.InputManager.ProcessStagingArea()
   at System.Windows.Input.InputProviderSite.ReportInput(InputReport inputReport)
   at System.Windows.Interop.HwndMouseInputProvider.ReportInput(IntPtr hwnd, InputMode mode, Int32 timestamp, RawMouseActions actions, Int32 x, Int32 y, Int32 wheel)
   at System.Windows.Interop.HwndMouseInputProvider.FilterMessage(IntPtr hwnd, WindowMessage msg, IntPtr wParam, IntPtr lParam, Boolean& handled)
   at System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource.InputFilterMessage(IntPtr hwnd, Int32 msg, IntPtr wParam, IntPtr lParam, Boolean& handled)
   at MS.Win32.HwndWrapper.WndProc(IntPtr hwnd, Int32 msg, IntPtr wParam, IntPtr lParam, Boolean& handled)
   at MS.Win32.HwndSubclass.DispatcherCallbackOperation(Object o)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)
   at MS.Internal.Threading.ExceptionFilterHelper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate method, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)
fields.summary: Shift-Clicking in 'File Status' list causes exception when it doesn't have focus

I tried repairing with the installer and no change.  I tried various compatibility modes, running as administrator, etc with no change.  I uninstalled, restarted the PC, downloaded a fresh copy and reinstalled.  I initially got the error shown in bug tracker code SRCTREEWIN-3964, but attempting another install seemed to work without errors.  I'm still getting the same crash on launch problem though.
